result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley Nichole Weisenberger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Mistreat Animals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Good faith effort to maintain full time work/full time school/actively working with case worker or a combination and when not fully engaged, must complete 9 hours community service per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as recommended.

DNA sample.

0 days credit if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashley Nichole Weisenberger

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 9:42 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen in person:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Paige Metzman in person;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
Ct. 2 (Intentionally Abandon Animal)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.
 
PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Intentionally Mistreat Animals)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (Intentionally Mistreat Animals)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, No Possession of any animals, I/S 60 Days MCJ, Complete 20 Hours of Community Service, Good Faith Effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school/Actively working with Case Worker or a combination and not not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 0 Days Credit if revoked.

Adjourned: 9:51 am

ADA Lacey Coonen appears in person; Atty Metzman appears in person
DATES REMAIN
